Hickory Lane   2nd Street    Thomas Drive  20
Mill Street    Range Street  Island Park   20
Spruce Street  2nd Street    Thomas Drive  20
Sycamore Lane  2nd Street    Thomas Drive  20
Thomas Drive   Sycamore Lane Spruce Street 20
Willow Street  2nd Street    Thomas Drive  20
 
(Ord. 697, 10-18-2010)
8-1-2: DRIVING WHILE INTOXICATED:
(Rep. by Ord. 259, 6-2-1980)
8-1-3: RECKLESS DRIVING:
(Rep. by Ord. 576, 3-21-2005)
8-1-4: U-TURNS:
(Rep. by Ord. 574, 3-21-2005)
8-1-5: TRAINS:
   (A)   Speed: Any railroad corporation shall not by itself or agents, run any
train, locomotive engine or car at a speed of more than fifteen (15) miles per
hour or less than ten (10) miles per hour through the corporate limits of the
city.
   (B)   Brakemen: Any railroad corporation operating or running any train,
locomotive engine or car through the city shall provide a brakeman with a
flashing red light or flares at any railroad- highway grade crossing in the
city through which said train, locomotive engine or car is passing if such
train, locomotive engine or car shall remain in the railroad tracks without
moving for any period in excess of ten (10) minutes, except where such train,
railroad car or engine cannot be moved by reason of circumstances over which
the railroad corporation has no control.
   (C)   Penalty: If any railroad corporation shall violate any of the
provisions of this section, said corporation shall be fined not less than one
hundred dollars ($100.00) nor more than two hundred dollars ($200.00) for each
offense. (Ord. 215, 3-6-1978)
8-1-6: ISLAND PARK BRIDGE:
No person shall operate a motorized vehicle on the pedestrian bridge which
connects North Maple Street with Island Park; provided, however, this section
shall not apply to motorized wheelchairs or any type of motorized vehicle used
by a physically handicapped person. Any person found guilty of this section
shall, upon conviction, be fined one hundred dollars ($100.00) for each
offense. (Ord. 387, 7-6-1992)
8-1-7: COMPRESSION RELEASE ENGINE BRAKING:
   (A)   Prohibited: No person shall operate or cause to be operated at or upon
any public highway located within one thousand feet (1,000') of any area of the
city of Momence that contains any single-family or multi-family dwelling units,
any compression/engine brake on any vehicle for any reason. For purposes of
this section, a "compression release engine brake" is defined as any mechanical
exhaust device designed to aid in the braking or deceleration of any vehicle by
converting engine power to compressed air which results in additional,
excessive, loud or explosive noise from such vehicle.
   (B)   Penalty: Any person found to be in violation of this section shall be
subject to fine of not less than seventy five dollars ($75.00), and not to
exceed seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00). (Ord. 495, 3-5-2001)
8-1-8: SPILLING LOADS AND DEPOSITING DEBRIS ON ROADWAYS PROHIBITED:
   (A)   No vehicle shall be driven within the city in such a manner as to
cause any dirt, clay, mud, stones or any other material to be deposited upon
any roadway. The owner or operator of any vehicle which deposits dirt, clay,
mud, stones or other material upon a roadway shall promptly remove such
material from the roadway.
   (B)   No person shall operate any vehicle with a load unless said load and
any covering thereon is securely fastened so as to prevent said covering or
load from becoming loose, detached, or from falling onto the roadway. (Ord.
626, 2-20-2007)
CHAPTER 2
STOPPING, STANDING, PARKING
SECTION:
8-2-1: No Parking Places
8-2-2: Parking At Curb
8-2-3: Parallel Parking
8-2-4: Vehicles For Sale
8-2-5: Loading Zone
8-2-6: All Night Parking
8-2-7: Time Limit Parking
8-2-8: Handicapped Parking Only
8-2-9: Standing, Stopping Or Parking; Where Prohibited
8-2-10: Improper Parking On Roadway
8-2-11: Tickets
8-2-12: Signs
8-2-13: Removal Of Illegally Parked Vehicles
8-2-14: Prima Facie Proof
8-2-15: Certain Streets; No Parking
8-2-16: Penalty
8-2-17: Parking During Snow Removal
8-2-18: Certain Streets; Residential Parking Only
8-2-19: School Bus Loading Zones
8-2-20: Parking Of Motorized Vehicles On Residential Areas
8-2-1: NO PARKING PLACES:
At any time it shall be unlawful to permit any vehicle to stand in any of the
following places, except when necessary to avoid conflict with other traffic or
in compliance with the directions of a police officer or traffic control
device:
   (A)   On any sidewalk or parkway.
   (B)   At any place where official signs prohibit parking. (Ord. 280, 3-1-
1982)
8-2-2: PARKING AT CURB:
No vehicle shall be parked with the left side of such vehicle next to the curb,
except on one-way streets, and it shall be unlawful to stand or park any
vehicle in a street other than parallel with the two (2) right wheels of the
vehicle within twelve inches (12") of the regularly established curb line,
except that upon those streets that have been marked for angle parking,
vehicles shall be parked at the angle to the curb indicated by such marks.
(Ord. 280, 3-1-1982)
8-2-3: PARALLEL PARKING:
   (A)   Definitions: Whenever in this section the following terms are used,
they shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them in this subsection:
    INTERSECTION: The area embraced within the prolongation of the property
lines of two (2) or more streets which join at an angle, whether or not such
streets cross.
   PROPERTY LINE: The line marking the boundary between any street and the lots
or property abutting thereon.
   ROADWAY OR STREET: Every way set aside for public travel except footpaths.
   VEHICLE: Every device in, upon or by which any person or property is or may
be transported or drawn upon a street, including bicycles.
   (B)   Parallel Parking: It shall be unlawful to park any vehicle on the
following roadway, except parallel to the curb as appropriately marked:
River Street from the intersection of Dixie Highway, also known as Illinois
State Route 1, easterly to the terminus of said River Street. (Ord. 280, 3-1-
1982)
8-2-4: VEHICLES FOR SALE:
   (A)   Vehicles that display a "For Sale" or similar sign shall be parked in
a lot on a hard surface where the sale of new or used vehicles is permitted.
(Hard surface includes: gravel, asphalt, and concrete.)
   (B)   A private individual may only park a vehicle with a "For Sale" sign
for display at that individual's home on a hard surface, including the driveway
or roadway in front/side of the residence. (Vehicles are prohibited from being
displayed on soft surfaces, such as grass or dirt.)
   (C)   A vehicle with a "For Sale" sign may not be maintained or parked for
display in the public right of way or public property for the sole purpose of
selling. (This section does not apply if the vehicle is parked incidental for
other purposes.)
   (D)   Any individual who violates any provision of this section shall be
subject to penalty as provided in this code, and as established in the list of
fines (subsection
1-4-1(B) of this code). (Ord. 765, 7-15-2013)
8-2-5: LOADING ZONE:
It shall be unlawful for the driver of a vehicle to stand a passenger vehicle
for a period of time longer than is necessary for the loading or unloading of
passengers, not to exceed three (3) minutes and for the driver to stand any
freight carrying vehicles for a period of time longer than is necessary to
load, unload and deliver materials, not to exceed thirty (30) minutes, in any
place designated by the mayor and council as a loading zone and marked as such.
(Ord. 280, 3-1-1982)
8-2-6: ALL NIGHT PARKING:
   (A)   Restricted Areas: No person shall park any vehicle on any of the
following streets, between the hours of two o'clock (2:00) A.M. and five
o'clock (5:00) A.M. of any day, except physicians on emergency calls:
North Dixie Highway from River Street north to Mechanic Street.
North Locust Street from River Street north to 2nd Street.
River Street from Pine Street east to Chocolate Street.
Second Street from Pine Street east to Walnut Street.
Washington Street from Pine Street east to Walnut Street. (Ord. 690, 7-5-2010)
8-2-7: TIME LIMIT PARKING:
   (A)   Purpose: Except on holidays, it shall be unlawful to park any vehicle
for a longer consecutive period of time than that designated, between the hours
of eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. and six o'clock (6:00) P.M. in any area designated
as a limited parking area and so marked.
   (B)   Lot Definitions: In this section and throughout this code:
Lot #1: City lot on the north side of River Street, and east of Dixie Highway.
Lot #2: City lot on the south side of River Street, and east of Dixie Highway.
Lot #3: City lot on the south side of River Street, and west of Dixie Highway.
Lot #4: City lot on the north side of Washington Street, and west of Dixie
Highway.
Lot #5: City lot on the north side of Mill Street, and east of Dixie Highway.
(Ord. 753, 11-19-2012)
   (C)   Fifteen Minute Parking: The following shall be designated fifteen (15)
minute parking:
The parking space on Dixie Highway on the northwest side thereof, next to River
Street, Monday through Sunday, from eight thirty o'clock (8:30) A.M. to eight
o'clock (8:00) P.M.
The parking space on Dixie Highway on the southeast side thereof, next to
Washington Street, Monday through Saturday, from seven thirty o'clock (7:30)
A.M. to four thirty o'clock (4:30) P.M.
The parking space on Dixie Highway on the southwest side thereof next to
Washington Street, and the parking space on Washington Street, on the southwest
side thereof, next to Dixie Highway, adjacent to the handicapped parking space.
The parking space on the north side of West Washington Street, adjacent to, and
west of the alley, Monday through Saturday, from eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. to
five thirty o'clock (5:30) P.M. (Ord. 753, 11-19-2012; amd. Ord. 770, 9-3-2013;
Ord. 778, 4-7-2014; Ord. 794, 5-4-2015)
   (D)   Two Hour Parking: It shall be unlawful to park any vehicle more than
two (2) consecutive hours on Washington Street between Pine Street and Locust
Street.
   (E)   Three Hour Parking: It shall be unlawful to park any vehicle more than
three (3) consecutive hours on:
City parking lot #1.
Dixie Highway, east and west side between 2nd Street and River Street.
Locust Street between 2nd Street and River Street. (Ord. 753, 11-19-2012)
8-2-8: HANDICAPPED PARKING ONLY:
It shall be prohibited to park any motor vehicle which is not bearing
registration plates issued to a physically handicapped person or disabled
veteran or such devices as local authorities deem proper as evidence that the
vehicle is operated by or for a handicapped person or disabled veteran in any
parking space specifically reserved, by posting of an official sign, for motor
vehicles bearing such registration plates.
   (A)   It shall be unlawful for any person to park any vehicle within any
parking area designated within the city for handicapped parking unless said
person is handicapped and is driving a vehicle with a city handicapped sticker.
   (B)   The parking spaces on Washington Street on the north side thereof next
to Locust Street on the east are hereby designated as handicapped parking
spaces. The chief of police of the city is hereby directed to post two (2) such
spaces on Washington Street adjacent to Locust Street as handicapped parking
spaces only. The city does hereby also designate one (1) handicapped parking
spot at 107 North Locust Street.
   (C)   The city council is hereby authorized from time to time by written
resolution to designate additional handicapped parking spaces for posting by
the chief of police for usage within the city by handicapped persons only.
(Ord. 573, 3-21-2005; amd. Res. 221, 5-6-2024)
8-2-9: STANDING, STOPPING OR PARKING; WHERE PROHIBITED:
Except when necessary to avoid conflict with other traffic or in compliance
with law or the directions of a police officer or official traffic control
device, no person shall stop, stand or park a vehicle:
   (A)   At any place where official sign prohibits parking or standing or
stopping;
   (B)   Between a safety zone and the adjacent curb or within thirty feet
(30') of points on the curb immediately opposite the ends of safety zone
indicated by signs or yellow markings;
   (C)   In front of a public or private driveway;
   (D)   Within fifteen feet (15') of a fire hydrant;
   (E)   Within twenty feet (20') of a crosswalk at an intersection;
   (F)   Within thirty feet (30') upon the approach to any flashing signal,
stop sign, yield sign or traffic control signal located at the side of a
roadway;
   (G)   Within twenty feet (20') of the driveway entrance to any fire station
and on the side of a street opposite the entrance to any fire station within
seventy five feet (75') of such entrance (when properly signposted). (Ord. 280,
3-1-1982)
8-2-10: IMPROPER PARKING ON ROADWAY:
No person shall stop, park or leave standing any vehicle, whether attended or
unattended, upon the roadway when it is practicable to stop, park or so leave
any vehicle off the roadway. The city, with respect to streets under its
jurisdiction or for the maintenance of any, may place signs prohibiting or
restricting the stopping, standing or parking of vehicles on any street where,
in its opinion, such stopping, standing or parking is dangerous to those using
the street or where the stopping, standing or parking of vehicles would unduly
interfere with the free movement of traffic thereon. (Ord. 280, 3-1-1982)
8-2-11: TICKETS:
Police officers, after making note of license number of the vehicle and the
name of the offender, where possible, may issue a ticket covering any parking
offense under this chapter, notifying the offender to pay the fine therefor at
the city hall. Such officer may sign a complaint for the issuance of a warrant
if the offender does not appear and pay said fine within the time specified.
(Ord. 280, 3-1-1982)
In the event that any person has at any time ten (10) or more parking tickets
outstanding, the police chief of the city or an officer under his direction is
hereby authorized to swear out a warrant for the arrest of such violator. Upon
the issuance of the arrest warrant, the city clerk shall mail said warrant to
the last known address of such offender. In the event that more than sixty (60)
days elapse from the date of such mailing of notification, then and in that
event, the city clerk is hereby authorized to notify the circuit clerk of
Kankakee County of such outstanding arrest warrant, number of parking tickets
unpaid, the full name, date of birth, sex, and driver's license number of the
violator, and the registration number of the motor vehicle registered to such
violator with request that the circuit clerk thereby on forms as prescribed by
the Illinois secretary of state request the Illinois secretary of state to
suspend the driver's license of such violator until such time as such tickets
are paid in full, all in accordance with the provisions of 625 Illinois
Compiled Statutes 5/6-306.5 as in force from time to time. (Ord. 309, 1-7-1985)
8-2-12: SIGNS:
The chief of police or any other person authorized by the mayor and council,
shall cause signs to be posted in all areas where parking is limited or
prohibited, indicating such limitations or prohibitions. (Ord. 280, 3-1-1982)
8-2-13: REMOVAL OF ILLEGALLY PARKED VEHICLES:
Any car or other vehicle parked on the aforementioned streets under section
8-2-6 of this chapter, during the hours when parking thereon is prohibited, may
be removed and towed away. The police department and all members thereof are
hereby authorized to remove and tow away or have removed and towed away by
commercial towing service, any such car or other vehicle parked in violation of
said section. Cars so towed away for illegal parking shall be stored in a safe
place and shall be restored to the owner or operator of such car upon payment
of a fee as determined by the mayor and council within twenty four (24) hours
after the time such car was removed. (Ord. 280, 3-1-1982)
8-2-14: PRIMA FACIE PROOF:
The fact that any car or other vehicle which is illegally parked is registered
in the name of a person shall be considered prima facie proof that such person
was in control of the automobile at the time of the violation. Proof of the
name of the person to whom the vehicle is registered may be made from printed
booklets issued by the secretary of state's office, Springfield, Illinois, and
such evidence shall be prima facie proof that the owner of said vehicle as
found therein is the registered owner thereof. (Ord. 309, 1-7-1985)
8-2-15: CERTAIN STREETS; NO PARKING:
   (A)   No Parking: At any time it shall be unlawful to permit any vehicular
parking on the following streets:
From the Dixie Highway east on Mill Street to the entrance to Island Park.
Harvard Street in the city; provided, however, that the parking of motor
vehicles is hereby allowed on both sides of Harvard Street in the 100 block
only.
North on Illinois Route 1 also known as Dixie Highway to River Street.
On both sides of Dixie Highway from Second Street to Third Street.
On both sides of Illinois Route 1/17, also known as Range Street, from Mechanic
Street northerly plus or minus five hundred feet (±500') to the north corporate
limits of Momence.
The junction of Route 1 and 17 and Route 114, also known as Illinois Route 1.
The north and south sides of Industrial Drive at any time.
Walnut Street between Oregon Street and Vermont Street.
West Washington Street from Pine Street to Hill Street.
      1.   At any time it shall be unlawful to permit the parking of any truck
whose gross weight exceeds eight thousand (8,000) pounds on the following
streets:
The east side of South Gladiolus Street between Vermont Street and Oregon
Street and the east and west sides of South Gladiolus Street from Oregon Street
to the south end of South Gladiolus Street. (Ord. 612, 10-17-2006)
   (B)   During Certain Hours:
It shall be unlawful to park any motor vehicle on either side of West Second
Street between Franklin Street and Hickory Street between the hours of eight
o'clock (8:00) A.M. and four o'clock (4:00) P.M.
It shall be unlawful to park any motor vehicle on the north side of West 4th
Street between Dixie Highway (Route 1) and Pine Street on school days, between
the hours of seven o'clock (7:00) A.M. and eight thirty o'clock (8:30) A.M.,
and between the hours of two o'clock (2:00) P.M. and three thirty o'clock (3:
30) P.M.
Any person who violates any provision of this subsection is guilty of a petty
offense and shall be fined in accordance with the City of Momence approved fine
list found in section
1-4-1 of this Code. (Ord. 768, 8-5-2013)
   (C)   Overweight Vehicles: It shall be unlawful for any person to park any
vehicle with an empty weight of more than eight thousand (8,000) pounds or any
vehicle with more than fourteen (14) wheels on Mechanic Street on either side
thereof between Pine Street and State Route 1 otherwise known as the Dixie
Highway at any time. (Ord. 285, 9-20-1982)
   (D)   Residential Areas: It shall be unlawful for any person to park any
motor vehicle on either side of the 500 block of North Chestnut Street or on
the north side of the 300 block of East Washington Street or 121 E. Second
Street, unless said motor vehicle belongs to a resident of said block and those
in the 500 block of North Chestnut Street, both sides and the 300 block of East
Washington Street, on the north side, are hereby designated as an area for
residential parking only and shall be posted as such. (Ord. 841, 5-21-2018)
No person shall park any vehicle on the west side of North Locust between
Mechanic Street and railroad tracks in the 700 block of North Locust unless
such person is a resident of said neighborhood or is visiting a resident of
said neighborhood, and no person shall park his or her vehicle in front of any
property on the east side of the 700 block of North Locust used for residential
purposes unless such person is a resident of said neighborhood or is visiting a
resident of said neighborhood. (Ord. 345, 10-5-1987)
8-2-16: PENALTY:
Any person who violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a petty
offense and shall be fined in accordance with the City of Momence approved fine
list found in section
1-4-1 of this Code. (Ord. 680, 4-19-2010)
8-2-17: PARKING DURING SNOW REMOVAL:
   (A)   Parking restrictions shall be in effect for the entire City during any
snowfall that accumulates to the point of requiring plows to clean the streets.
All residents shall be required to adhere to parking restrictions as defined:
      1.   On odd dates, vehicles shall be parked only on the side of the
street with even numbered houses or buildings.
      2.   On even dates, vehicles shall be parked only on the side of the
street with odd numbered houses or buildings.
      3.   Odd or even dates shall be determined at seven o'clock (7:00) A.M.
and run until seven o'clock (7:00) A.M. the following morning.
      4.   Street sides with open space or no buildings shall be considered as
being numbered the opposite of the other side of the street.
      5.   These restrictions will be in place for a minimum of forty eight
(48) hours after the snowfall ends or until any street in question is
completely cleared.
   (B)   Any person who violates any provision of this section is guilty of a
petty offense and shall be fined in accordance with the City of Momence
approved fine list found in section
1-4-1 of this Code.
   (C)   In the event that any vehicle is so illegally parked after the
requisite snowfall accumulation, the police shall, upon finding any such
vehicle in violation, post a sign on said vehicle indicating the violation and
requiring it to be moved within twenty four (24) hours. If such vehicle is not
removed within twenty four (24) hours so as to be in compliance with this
section, the police shall cause the vehicle to be towed and the cost of towing
shall be paid by the owner thereof in addition to any fine otherwise imposed by
this section. (Ord. 777, 4-7-2014)
8-2-18: CERTAIN STREETS; RESIDENTIAL PARKING ONLY:
   (A)   At any time it shall be unlawful to permit any vehicular parking
except for residents immediately adjacent thereto on the following streets:
Oregon Street.
The southeast corner of Second and Market Streets.
The southeast corner of Third and Pine Streets.
The southwest corner of Pine and West Washington Streets.
112 South Walnut Street. (Ord. 634, 8-6-2007; amd. Ord. 756, 3-18-2013; Ord.
759, 5-6-2013)
   (B)   The following streets are designated as "residential parking only"
areas, during the hours of six o'clock (6:00) A.M. to four o'clock (4:00) P.M.
on Monday through Friday, and vehicular parking shall be restricted to
residents immediately adjacent thereto:
Cherry Street.
Hickory Street.
Sycamore Street. (Ord. 634, 8-6-2007)
8-2-19: SCHOOL BUS LOADING ZONES:
   (A)   Parking shall be prohibited in designated school bus loading zones
between seven thirty o'clock (7:30) A.M. and eight thirty o'clock (8:30) A.M.
and between two thirty o'clock (2:30) P.M. and three thirty o'clock (3:30)
P.M., on any day in which school is being held.
   (B)   The following locations are hereby established as school bus loading
zones within the city of Momence:
The south side of Second Street between Virden Street and the driveway of the
east parking lot at the Momence Junior High School.
The west side of Franklin Street between Second Street and River Street. (Ord.
604, 3-20-2006)
8-2-20: PARKING OF MOTORIZED VEHICLES ON RESIDENTIAL AREAS:
   (A)   To park, store or keep any motorized vehicle in any rear, side, or
front setback on private property on grass is prohibited. This provision does
not include recreational vehicles, golf carts, and/or nonhighway vehicles.
   (B)   Loading, unloading, and visiting, provided no type of hazard is
created, with prior notification and approval by the police department, will be
permitted. (Ord. 782, 6-2-2014)
CHAPTER 3
INTERSECTIONS; THROUGH STREETS
SECTION:

8-3-1: DEFINITIONS:
Whenever in this chapter the following terms are used, they shall have the
meanings respectively ascribed to them in this section:
INTERSECTION: The area embraced within the prolongation of the property lines
of two (2) or more streets which join at an angle, whether or not such streets
cross.
PROPERTY LINE: The line marking the boundary between any street and the lots or
property abutting thereon.
ROADWAY OR STREET: Every way set aside for public travel except footpaths.
VEHICLE: Every device in, upon or by which any person or property is or may be
transported or drawn upon a street, including bicycles. (Ord., 9-15-1958)

8-3-3: YIELD INTERSECTIONS DESIGNATED:
(Rep. by Ord. 698, 12-6-2010)
8-3-4: THROUGH STREETS DESIGNATED:
The following streets and parts of streets are hereby declared to constitute
through streets, and it shall be unlawful to drive any vehicle into the
intersection of the following named streets without first bringing such vehicle
to a full stop:
Railroad Avenue.
Washington Street from the Momence High School to the Kankakee River. (Ord.
691, 7-19-2010)
8-3-5: SIGNS AND SIGNALS:
Suitable signs shall be erected designating stop and yield intersections. It
shall be unlawful for the driver of any vehicle to disobey the instructions of
any traffic sign or signal placed in view by authority of the city council or
in accordance with the laws of the state. All signs established by direction of
the city council shall conform to the state standards for traffic signs. (Ord.,
3-18-1963)
   (A)   Left Turn Prohibited: It shall be unlawful for traffic southbound on
Pine Street to turn left at the intersection of Pine Street and 6th Street.
(Ord. 476, 5-17-1999)
8-3-6: TICKETS:
Police officers, after making note of the license number of the vehicle and the
name of the offender where possible, may issue a traffic violation ticket
covering offenses under this chapter notifying the offender to appear in court
at the time designated for hearing such cases. Such officer may sign a
complaint for the issuance of a warrant if the offender does not appear at the
time and place so specified. (Ord. 187, 7-19-1976)
8-3-7: ARRESTS:
Any person arrested for a violation of this chapter shall be released upon
proper bail being furnished as required by statute. (Ord. 187, 7-19-1976)
